sense.def: Alternative Names fu yu 怫鬱 , anger with pent-up [qi].

① Alternative Names yu jie 鬱結 , pent-up [qi] with nodes; yu e 鬱遏 , pent-up [qi] with containment; yu yi 鬱抑 , pent-up [qi] with restraint: yu xu 鬱蓄 , pent-up [qi] with accumulation. Etiological Agent. of pathological qi stagnating and collecting inside the human body. While mostly related to stagnation and collection of qi, yu 鬱 , accumulation, may also result from stagnation/collection of fire, phlegm, food, moisture, and blood. Su wen 素問 3: 勞汗當風，寒薄為皶，鬱乃痤 , “If in a state of exhaustion one sweats and encounters wind, and if cold strikes [against the skin], this leads to blotches; in the case of pent-up [qi] , this will generate acne”.

② Alternative Names you yu 憂鬱 , grief with pent-up [qi]; you men 鬱悶 , pent-up [qi] with heart-pressure. Illness Sign of a feeling of distress and unhappiness. Shang han lun 傷寒論 103: 嘔不止、心 下急、鬱鬱微煩者，為未解也 , “In cases in which vomiting does not end, with a [feeling of] tightness below the heart, and pent-up [qi] w ith a slight vexation, it has not been resolved yet”.
